body.name: Eoin Colfer: Artemis Fowl: The Arctic Incident: The Graphic Novel-Graphic Novel, The

editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews About the Author Eoin Colfer is the author of the New York Times best-selling Artemis Fowl series, the first book of which was adapted into a major motion picture from the Walt Disney Studios. He also wrote the series spin-offs The Fowl Twins and The Fowl Twins Deny All Charges, as well as many other titles for young readers and adults, including Highfire, Iron Man: The Gauntlet, Airman, Half Moon Investigations, Eoin Colfer's Legend of . . . books, The Wish List, Benny and Omar; and Benny and Babe. In 2014, he was named Ireland's laureate for children's literature. He lives with his wife and two sons in Dublin, Ireland. To learn more, visit www.eoincolfer.com. He is also on Twitter and Instagram @EoinColfer. Michael Moreciis a bestselling comics author and novelist. His novels include Black Star Renegades and its sequel, We Are Mayhem. In the comics world, he's created numerous critically acclaimed original titles (Wasted Space, The Plot, Curse) and has written for many established universes (Star Wars, Archie, Stranger Things). Michael lives in Oak Park with his family. Follow him on Twitter @MichaelMoreci.Stephen Gilpin (www.sgilpin.com) is the illustrator of more than thirty children's books, including Volume 2 in the Wires and Nerve graphic novel series based on Marissa Meyer's Lunar Chronicles. Follow him on Twitter @Sparkgilpin.

body.description: The second book in the internationally best-selling Artemis Fowl series by Eoin Colfer is available as a full-color graphic novel with all-new text and artwork.The world's youngest, brightest, and most dangerous criminal mastermind is back.Artemis Fowl receives an urgent e-mail from Russia. In it is a plea from a man who has been kidnapped by the Russian Mafiya: his father.As Artemis rushes to his dad's rescue, he is stopped by a familiar nemesis: Captain Holly Short of the LEPrecon fairy police. Now, instead of battling the fairies, Artemis must join them if he wants to save one of the few people in the world he loves.This all-new adaptation with exciting and cinematic full-color artwork will engage fans both old and new and leave them eagerly awaiting the next installment.Artemis Fowl, a major motion picture from Walt Disney Studios, is now streaming on Disney+!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Artemis Fowl Airman The Fowl Twins Also by #1 New York Times best-selling author Eoin Colfer Eoin Colfer’s beloved novel about a teenage criminal mastermind and his siege against dangerous, tech-savvy fairies. Zorro meets The Count of Monte Cristo in this dazzling, action-packed classic from the author of the Artemis Fowl series. With all the hallmarks that made the Artemis Fowl series so popular, this hilarious spin-off adventure stars Artemis' younger brothers, along with a nefarious nobleman, a shadowy nun, and a fairy intern, and a maverick troll.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Would buy again

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Printing issues have been fixed (original headline: DEFECTIVE!!)
reviews.reviewText: (My original review read: "Other reviewers have mentioned the duplicate pages, but it's more than that: Not only do some pages appear twice, but the duplicate pages are taking the place of pages that should be there, so important parts of the story are missing.")The publishers have fixed the problem, and the latest print run has gotten rid of the duplicate pages and inserted the missing ones.There is no visible difference between the two books at all, and I do not know if the remaining copies in the initial run have been recalled. So, if you purchase one, I'd suggest flipping through the pages looking for duplication.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Pages still missing
reviews.reviewText: Like others, I got a book with some pages duplicated and others missing. Why are these misprinted books still being shipped?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Quality graphic novel, but significant production issues
reviews.reviewText: As has been noted, there are production issues with the first/initial printing where multiple pages (more than 5) are duplicated while others are missing entirely.Story art and print quality are excellent - on par with the first graphic novel. But I can't give the item itself a better review due to the production issues. As soon as they can fix those, I will happily repurchase and would rate it around 4.5 stars.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars This book has errors.
reviews.reviewText: The book has repeating pages I would not recommend this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2021
reviews.reviewText: Starting in Chapter 8, there are multiple misprints to the end of the book. Pages are printed out of order and there are duplicate pages as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars This is a warning about only the hardcover version of this book.
reviews.reviewText: The problem with this book was not discovered until the book had been read by several of my students who all told me the book was hard to follow and made no sense.I buy hardcover books from my own funds to put books that are new interesting in my classroom for my students to read and discuss. There are no school funds to acquire non-academic material for my class anymore so I buy these books with my own money. This is an excellent story for my students to discuss and compare with their own experiences and expectations. Books like this help me to make everything a learning experience.The defect in this book was caused by the misprinting of 5 pages being duplicated in the last half of the book. If the problem was just 5 extra pages, it would not be a big problem because the 5 extra pages could have been ignored by the reader.In this book however, the problem is that the 5 "extra pages" were printed in place of the 5 pages that actually belonged there.The missing pages caused the story to be missing a great portion of the narrative and made it impossible to follow the story. The "extra" pages follow the correct location by exactly 2 pages. This is simply a message to warn you to check the copy of this book you have purchased so you can return it within the time limit if it is defective. Because of the way modern printing machines operate it is likely that the printing operation prints several copies worth of pages at a time and that only one group of pages from the many that are printed may have this problem. I found this error after comparing the hardcover version of this book with the softcover version after my students complained about the book being difficult to read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars There are issues with double printed pages
reviews.reviewText: The story is great and my son enjoyed it, but the printing has issues where some of the panels were double printed in a few places. Ordered 2 different copies and both have the issues so I believe this is systematic from the printing press.

reviews.reviewTitle: Zero stars if I could give it
reviews.reviewText: DO NOT order this book! I have tried to order it twice and this is what happens as soon as you open the book! It completely falls apart from the spine. Now I’m inconvenienced with having to ship yet another one back to Amazon for a refund.
Received a torn book, requested for an exchange.. however the second book that was sent had the same issue. All pages from the center binding were falling off.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: Character drawings not true to book
reviews.reviewText: My kids were really disappointed that the characters were drawn differently to how they are depicted in the book and so didn't enjoy this at all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 4, 2021
reviews.reviewText: My daughter loves this series but when this one arrived it had several pages printed twice accidentally like it was printed in a hurry, very annoying. If printed correctly it would have been 5 stars.
